Rule.title: Check existence of the log files.

description.xhtml:p: Log files should exist on all GNU/Linux systems.
Missing log files may be proof that the system has been compromised.

The following log files will be checked:
/var/log/wtmp
/var/log/btmp
/var/log/lastlog
/var/log/utmp
/var/log/messages

Rule.fix:
function fix { name=$1 owner=$2 group=$3 perm=$4
if [ ! -e $name -o ! -f $name ] then rm -rf $name
touch $name chown $owner $name chgrp $group $name chmod $perm $name fi }
fix /var/log/wtmp root utmp 664 fix /var/log/btmp root utmp 600 fix /var/log/lastlog root root 644 fix /var/run/utmp root utmp 664 fix /var/log/messages root root 600

Rule.title: Check owner of the log files.

description.xhtml:p: Log files should be owned by root.
Improper file permissions could compromise the integrity of the log files, defeating their purpose.

The following log files will be checked:
/var/log/wtmp
/var/log/btmp
/var/log/lastlog
/var/log/utmp
/var/log/messages

Rule.fix: chown root /var/log/wtmp chown root /var/log/btmp chown root /var/log/lastlog chown root /var/run/utmp chown root /var/log/messages

Rule.title: Check group of the log files.

description.xhtml:p: Log files should be owned by root.
Improper file permissions could compromise the integrity of the log files, defeating their purpose.

The following log files will be checked:
/var/log/wtmp
/var/log/btmp
/var/log/lastlog
/var/log/utmp
/var/log/messages

Rule.fix: chgrp utmp /var/log/wtmp chgrp utmp /var/log/btmp chgrp root /var/log/lastlog chgrp utmp /var/run/utmp chgrp root /var/log/messages
